definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: Don't try to be a jack of all trades, become a master of one.
sentences.chinese: 不要想着成为万事通，去成为某一样事的专家。

sentences.english: Position yourself as the go-to person who knows the history of the company, customers, and business.
sentences.chinese: 成为了解公司历史，客户，公司业务的万事通。

sentences.english: I am not a man of hidden talents but I may be considered as a jack of all trades .
sentences.chinese: 我随说不上是一个身怀绝技的人，但也算是个万事通。
一个标准的瞎眼万事通。

sentences.english: A T-shaped software developer is a jack-of-all-trades, but a master of one.
sentences.chinese: T形软件开发者是万事通，但是却精于某一项技能。

sentences.english: Grace is always correcting other people. She thinks she’s a know-it-all.
sentences.chinese: 格雷斯总是在纠正别人，她觉得自己是万事通。

definition: to possess great magical power/to possess remarkable abilities
an eccentric/odd person/person of extraordinary talent
sth else/a separate matter/not the same thing/with different jobs (not colleagues)/a remarkable thing/sth special/an odd thing/sth strange or incomprehensible
lit. your honored carriage/your highness/honored Sir (also sarcastic)/you
lit. hidden dragon, crouching tiger (idiom)/fig. talented individuals in hiding/concealed talent
to subdue a tiger/fig. to prevail over sinister forces
Ziyun Hmong and Buyei autonomous county in Anshun 安順|安顺[An1 shun4], Guizhou
variant of 軼聞|轶闻[yi4 wen2]
